name: ugali
instructions: Boil water until it bubbles. The water should be very hot. This ensures the ugali will cook perfectly.
Add a cup full of flour into the water. Let it cook a few seconds until water starts to cover the flour.
Use a wooden spoon to quickly start mixing the flour and water.
Add a handful of flour and continue to mix the water and flour it will start to come together.
Reduce heat to medium and keep turning the ugali as it continues to stick together.
Gather the ugali and press it onto the side of the sufuria.
Place the wooden spoon under the ugali and form into a ball in the middle of the sufuria.
Repeat pressing the ugali on the side of the sufuria and turning it to the middle.
Once the ugali has become firm, turn it once more and smoothen it into a round. You will know your ugali is ready once you start to smell the aroma clearly.
Turn the ugali over onto a plate.
Dip the wooden spoon into water and use it to smoothen the ugali into a round ball on the plate.
Serve the ugali whole or slice. Enjoy with your favorite stew, meat, veggies, fish etc.

name: chapati
instructions: Heat 2 cups water add salt to taste to the water. Grate your carrots using the smaller part of your grater.

Add the grated carrots to your warm salty water, Pour the flour into a basin create a hole in the flour, Pour in the warm water with carrots bit by bit to the hole and knead inwards. Knead till it forms a sticky firm dough.
Add 35mls cooking oil and continue kneading till oil is well incorporated into the dough.
Cover your dough with a clean piece of cloth for at least 30mins, As you prepare your source of heat and working surface
For your chapatis to be in layers when cooked, you have to make dough balls which you'll use to roll your dough to circular small shapes.
Spread flour on your working surface.
Spread your dough on top of the flour.
Make a big circle dough.
Spread 2 tablespoon on top of the dough and spread evenly.
Cut the dough into small strips
Role each strip to make a roll.
Place each roll aside, ensuring that they don't get in touch with each other.
Cover your rolls with a clean piece of cloth. Let it rest for 10mins

Bring roll to your preheated pan. Cook both sides. Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the top part of your chapati and spread evenly. Turn and do the same to the other part. Cook your chapatis under moderate heat so that they don't burn.
Till the last one, Ensure you have a serviet placed on the surface of your storage place to prevent the chapatis from being wet from the moisture. Cover up with a lid so they don't dry.
serve hot with some nice stew.

name: kenyan tea
instructions: Boil water in a saucepan.
Add sugar and tea powder in it and boil it for 3- 4 minutes on medium flame.
Add milk and boil it over medium flame for 6-7 minutes or until bubbles start to rise. You will see the change in color of tea from milky shade to brown shade when it is ready.
Turn off the gas and strain tea in cups.
